div.p: Store all data needed to audit sellers, buyers and arbiters by any party involved.

ul.li: User ID: Generated from public key to optionally remain anonymous
Listing IDs: Pointer to market database ID
User ID: Generated from public key to optionally remain anonymous

ul.li: Client accesses a single node in a shard group at a time. This will keep read consistency unless a node goes down and a client must access another node. Read inconsistency should be OK if it's rare (maybe warn the user).
Critical writes should be consistent across a shard group. This happens when creating/editing listings.

The DB is also used to aggregate data from the blockchain and join it with the data in the node's DB. This can be used to calculate and cache data on sellers/buyers/listings/etc. Writing this data can be limitedly inconsistent.

div.span: The ethereum block chain serves as the source of truth for all auditable data. To join the market pool, you'll need to synchronize local data to data in the market pool and blockchain

ul.li: Determine the Shard Group to Join based on metadata about the market pool on the blockchain
Recalculate cache data from blockchain and group records
